result.execSummary:
The defendant Kody Christopher Mrozak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.notes: DEF pleads NC to ct#1 court accepts the plea and enters into Deferred Prosecution agreement.  Court approves the Deferred Agreement, victim notification complete.   Deferred for  3 years with DA, condiitons are no crimal acts, comply with terms of probation in Rusk 14CF16 and Sawyer 13CF202, complete sex offener treatment keep address current, no contact with JYR 4-18-00,   Absolute Sobriety  No drug use without a valid prescription.

supervisions.notes: $518 court costs including DE must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge.  If DE is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
10 years prison:  5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision.
Terms of conditions of extended supervision to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.dispoDesc:
11-09-17:   Deferred prosecution agreement revoked.  Court sentences:  10 years prison:  5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision.
58 days credit for time served.  DE is not eligible for Challenge incarceration or Substance Abuse programming.
Terms of conditions of extended supervision to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

records.addlTxt: Letters regarding DE from others provided at sentencing.
Voter ineligibility notice and acknowledgment

Defendant Kody Christopher Mrozak in court, with attorney James McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kody Christopher Mrozak in custody. 
Both attorneys acknowledge receipt of PSI.  No additions or corrections by either.
Atty Poquette makes sentencing statement- for 6 years initial confinement with 6 years extended supervision, with 58 days credit. Atty Poquette states victim rights legislation, court so finds.
 Atty McLaughlin agrees with credit stated, makes statement.
DE's mother makes statement, DE makes statement.
Court sentences:  10 years prison:  5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision.
58 days credit for time served.  DE is not eligible for Challenge incarceration or Substance Abuse programming.  Pay court costs $518.00.  
Terms of conditions of extended supervision to be determined by the Department of Corrections.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 9, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 21, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Case called. Defendant Kody Christopher Mrozak in court with attorney James McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty McLaughlin: No basis to oppose State's motion. 
Court vacates deferred JOC. Enter judgment of conviction. Orders PSI. Bail revoked.  Sentence adjustment review scheduled for September 21, 2017 at 11:00 am.
